page.title: 06WATERSTON vs GULF REFINERY
page.content: The people of{Waterston}were understandably concerned at the decision to build a{multi_million {pound oil refinery}on their doorstep. The promise of{local employment}in the Refinery and in associated industries did little to allay the fears of some residents. For years after the commissioning and opening of the refinery the villagers fought{legal battles}for compensation against noise, fumes and noxious gases which they claimed were emitted. The refinery{installed low noise {equipment}and built earth deflectors to reduce noise emissions. They also built a{community hall}to be used by the Refinery and the villagers. Now almost 20 years on there is a general acceptance on both sides. by John Mason & Eileen Seal
